ossj.qos.ri.pm.measurement.eis
Class Log

java.lang.Object
  ossj.qos.ri.pm.measurement.eis.Log
public class Log
extends java.lang.Object

This is a log class used by the EIS Simulator.

Examples of usage: 

 // Create a Log object with loglevel 3 (default) that will output
 // log messages to stdout.
 Log myLog = new Log()
 // The first parameter is the loglevel. If the parameter is below or
 // equal to the Log object loglevel the log message will be logged.
 myLog.log( 2, "This string will be written to the log" );

 // Create a Log Object with loglevel 3
 // that will send log messages to both file and stdout.
 Log myLog = new Log( "c:/logfile.txt" );

 // Create a Log Object with loglevel 5
 // that will send log messages to both file and stdout.
 Log myLog = new Log( "c:/logfile.txt", 5 );
 // The following log message will NOT be sent to file or stdout.
 myLog.log( 3, "This message will not appear in the log since 3 < 5." );

Copyright (c) 2001 Ericsson

Method Summary

Constructor Detail

Log

public Log()
This constructor creates a Log object with default logLevel and all log messages will be sent to stdout.

Log

public Log(java.lang.String logFile)
This constructor creates a Log object with default logLevel. Log messages will be sent to stdout and stored in the specified log file.

Parameters:
logFile - specifies the path and name of the log file

Log

public Log(java.lang.String logFile,
           java.lang.String logLevel)
This constructor creates a Log object with specified logLevel. All log messages will be sent to stdout and stored in the specified log file.

Parameters:
logFile - specifies the path and name of the log file
logLevel - log level for Log object. A low log level will give a log of high detail.
Method Detail

log

public void log(java.lang.String logMessage)
Always log a message independant of the current log level.

Parameters:
logMessage - log message that should be sent to log

log

public void log(java.lang.String logMessage,
                int logLevel)
Log a message if the parameter logLevel is larger then or equal to the current log level.

Parameters:
logMessage - log message that should be sent to log
logLevel - log level of log message
